skill.name: journey-map
skill.description: Create customer journey maps for user flows and workflows. Use when the user asks to "map the journey", "analyze user flow", "document the workflow", "trace the path", or needs to understand end-to-end user experiences.
skill.summary: Create customer journey maps for user flows and workflows. Use when the user asks to "map the journe...
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidance in markdown format. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. Pure prompt-based skill with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Mapping customer journeys helps teams visualize user experiences and identify where users encounter problems. This skill guides you through documenting user flows to find pain points and opportunities for improvement.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through journey mapping methodology
Define user personas and their goals
Structure journey phases from awareness to retention
Document touchpoints with emotions and pain points
Generate emotion curves for user sentiment
limitations: Does not generate visual diagrams or graphics
Requires user to provide context about their product or service
Does not integrate with external design tools automatically
Does not collect or analyze real user data

use_cases.title: Plan feature improvements
use_cases.description: Understand user flows to prioritize which features to build or improve based on journey friction points.

use_cases.title: Document user experiences
use_cases.description: Create standardized journey maps to communicate user experiences and pain points to stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Analyze workflow gaps
use_cases.description: Map existing user journeys to identify where processes break down or opportunities are missed.

prompt_templates.title: Simple journey map
prompt_templates.prompt: Map the customer journey for [describe user persona] trying to [task or goal]. Include phases from awareness to retention.

prompt_templates.title: Pain point focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a journey map that highlights pain points for [user type] completing [specific task]. Focus on where users feel frustrated or abandon the process.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-touchpoint analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Map every touchpoint for [journey name]. For each step, document the action, interface, user thought, emotion, pain point, and opportunity.

prompt_templates.title: Emotion curve
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an emotion curve journey map showing how user confidence and satisfaction change through [process or flow]. Show highs, lows, and critical moments.

output_examples.input: Map the journey for a first-time user signing up for a SaaS product
output: ‚Ä¢ Context: New user wants to start using the software, triggered by marketing email
‚Ä¢ Phases: Awareness ‚Üí Consideration ‚Üí Decision ‚Üí Action ‚Üí Retention
‚Ä¢ Key pain points: Long form, unclear pricing, confusion about next steps after signup
‚Ä¢ Emotion dip: Neutral at signup ‚Üí Frustrated during onboarding ‚Üí Delighted after first success
‚Ä¢ Top opportunity: Simplify onboarding to 3 steps, add progress indicator

best_practices: Start with a clear persona definition including their goals, trigger, and success criteria
Document emotions at each step to identify where users feel confident versus frustrated
Focus on actionable opportunities rather than just listing problems
Validate journey maps with real users through interviews or testing
anti_patterns: Creating journeys without defining who the user is and what they want to achieve
Skipping the emotional journey and only documenting actions
Including every single step instead of focusing on meaningful phases and touchpoints
Failing to connect pain points to specific recommendations for improvement

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill integrates with ux-expert agent for deeper analysis and ux-audit skill for touchpoint evaluation.

faq.question: How long should a journey map be?
faq.answer: Keep it focused. A useful journey map covers 5-12 key steps with context, phases, emotions, and recommendations.

faq.question: Can I use this for B2B workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. Journey mapping works for any user flow including B2B processes, internal tools, and complex multi-step workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill processes only what you provide in the prompt. No data is stored or sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my journey map too long?
faq.answer: Group detailed steps into phases. Focus on meaningful touchpoints rather than every micro-interaction or click.

faq.question: How is this different from user stories?
faq.answer: Journey maps show the end-to-end experience across time. User stories focus on individual features or tasks in isolation.
